orgName: Project Selborne - To Provide a Training Service for Royal Navy and Royal Marines
Title: Project Selborne - Provision of a Training Service to the Royal Navy and Royal Marines
Description:
Project Selborne's will contract for the delivery of Naval Service Training, some of which is already outsourced, across UK establishments, modernising the approach to training design, delivery and encouraging innovative solutions. This aligns with the Maritime Training Strategy (MTS) to provide relevant, innovative and modern training, underpinned by collaborative working which delivers the human component of Maritime Force Elements at Readiness to enable Operational success. Collaborative working between the Contractor and the Authority is an essential enabler to achieve the intended outcomes. Selborne's focus is to prioritise quality and improvement of RN individual training outcomes through modernisation.  In addition to the provision of training, the Contractor will be responsible for: (i) designing, procuring and managing the supply of, and the maintenance and repair of all associated training equipment; (ii) delivering/managing and procuring the interior design and fit out of a new Authority premises which has been built to house the provision of training services and, upon completion, delivering/managing the relocation of training activities from an existing site to the new premises.
      
      The Training Service to be delivered by the Contractor under this Contract represents the convergence of multiple legacy contracts, primarily FOAP(T), into a single arrangement for the integrated delivery of an end-to-end service for the training of Naval Service Personnel.   These legacy contracts and activities vary and will be incrementally included into Selborne over the Contract Term. The Authority may incorporate all or part of the legacy contracts and/or in-house service provision.
      The Authority intends to bring the legacy contracts and in-house service provision together into a single Contract to enable the Authority to transfer the management of such training services to a single Contractor and for the Contractor to improve Value for Money for the Authority, by exploiting commonality, coherence and synergies between training services to improve the quality and efficiency of service provision, and by giving the Contractor more scope to identify and implement opportunities for improvements and modernisation across wider Maritime Training.
      
      The Contractor will also manage military assets, equipment, documentation, that will be supplied as Government Furnished Assets (GFA) and manage a cadre of Naval Service instructors as Government Furnished Resource (GFR).

Title: Repair of Warrior Hydraulic Pumps and Motors
Description:
Any resultant Contract will be placed with a single Contractor in order to carry out repair activities as follows;
-	to repair Articles as per OEM Specification with an accompanying Certificate of Conformity where required. 
-	to supply all spares/components necessary to undertake the repair process, subsequent packaging to appropriate Military Packing Levels and the delivery of Articles to the Authority post completion of repair activity will be expected. 
The Repair will include, but not limited to: 
Process of Repair • Repair: All Articles are to be repaired to A1 condition as per OEM Specification. • Component Parts: All faulty, damaged or missing component parts that are required to repair the equipment shall be replaced using the current OEM/Genuine manufacturer's parts or to the OEM Specification, as appropriate. • Replacement parts: The Contractor shall be responsible for the procurement of all replacement parts within the terms and conditions of the contract. When replacement/alternative parts are used because OEM parts are no longer available, Certificates of Conformity are required for all parts which may affect the reliability of the equipment. These certificates shall be made available to the Authority
upon request. • Testing on completion: On completion of the Repair activity, a functional test/inspection shall be carried out on the equipment, in accordance with the OEM Test Specification. All test equipment used is to be provided and maintained by the Contractor. • The Contractor is to keep records of all visits/survey reports, repair approvals, certificates and costs incurred in the repairs to these equipments.

Title: Finance & HR Outsourced Services
Description:
The Defence Reform Act 2014 established the Single Source Regulations Office ("SSRO") as an independent regulator of the UK Government's procurement of single source military equipment and services.  The SSRO is the custodian of the single source procurement framework and has a number of functions under the Act and the Single Source Contract Regulations 2014.
The SSRO is seeking to award a contract for the provision of outsourced Finance and HR Support services. The SSRO requires these services to ensure the efficient and effective discharge of its functions. 
The Finance and HR Support services which the SSRO requires are summarised in the table below:

Required Service 


Finance service 
Financial Accounting Services: maintain the integrity of the financial database and chart of accounts by undertaking periodic housekeeping and reconciliation routines on the General Ledger.


Management Accounting Service: maintain the integrity of the structures (e.g. chart of accounts, activity centre structure, journal definitions) within the financial database.


Resource accounts: ensure this element of the Annual Report and Accounts provides a true and fair view of the SSRO's financial position at the time of the preparation of the accounts.


Payments to suppliers and employees: provision of a payments service via a secure environment within the parameters of available systems controls, for the upload of purchase ledger transactions, through to the production and dispatch of the required payment instrument, (including BACS and CHAPS). 


Payroll service 
Delivery of a payroll service that is legally compliant with all relevant HMRC submissions completed. The SSRO has 1 monthly payroll and its current resource is circa 50 employees.


HR service
Delivery of a fully managed integrated HR service that provides HR administration functions including self-service functionality. 



The SSRO is seeking to award the above outsourced service(s) to a contractor, which will run for a minimum term of 3 years.
Attachments: Finance & HR Services ITT.docx Appendix 1 Brief.docx Appendix 2 Response to Tender Questions.docx Appendix 3 Pricing Schedule.docx Appendix 4 KPI - Service Standards.docx Appendix 5 Standard Terms and Conditions for services.docx Appendix 6 Form of Tender.docx Appendix 7 Statement of Conduct.docx SSRO-C-72 Finance & HR Outsourced Services  -  Clarification Questions.docx

Title: Legal Services Framework
Description:
The Defence Reform Act 2014 established the Single Source Regulations Office ("SSRO") as an independent regulator of the UK Government's procurement of single source military equipment and services.  The SSRO is the custodian of the single source procurement framework and has a number of functions under the Act and the Single Source Contract Regulations 2014.

The SSRO is establishing a legal framework agreement, under which it will appoint up to two Contractors to provide legal services from time to time. The SSRO expects to require legal advice and support to ensure the efficient and effective discharge of its functions. 

The types of legal work which the SSRO may require from time to time are wide ranging, but key areas are summarised:
Public law - Defence Reform Act 2014 and Single Source Contract Regulations 2014 (including referrals and determinations thereunder).
Other - relevant legislation and legal matters which concern the functioning of public bodies.
Commercial - Public procurement & Contracts.
Information - Freedom of Information, Data Protection and GDPR.
Employment - Employment law generally and disputes.

The SSRO is seeking to appoint up to two suppliers to the framework agreement, which will run for a term of 3 years.

Title: The Provision of ISO 9001 certification and Maintenance Services
Description:
A UKAS accredited certified body to provide initial ISO 9001 certification and required surveillance over a standard assessment cycle of three years. The contract will include pre-assessment gap analysis, certification, awareness training and evaluations of continuing compliance to the standard. 
The successful contractor shall conduct the following activities associated with obtaining and maintaining ISO 9001 certification: 
Gap Assessment. A transition gap assessment evaluating our transition plan and Business Management System (BMS) comparing it with the requirements of ISO 9001reporting areas of compliance and non-compliance. 
Transition Plan. Determine a methodology for subsuming current units in DE&S holding ISO 9001 certification (taking into consideration differing locations and operating centres) and integrating in to the DE&S ISO 9001 certification. 
Initial Certification. Issue initial ISO 9001 certification to DE&S upon successful achievement of the standard. 
Training. Deliver awareness training to DE&S Senior Management awareness training, for up to 130 staff, about the ISO 9001 standard and their responsibilities in achieving and maintaining certification, highlighting the behaviours expected and taking ownership. 
Surveillance. Supply auditors/assessors with experience of auditing within the Military Equipment provisioning and in-service support (including logistics) environment. Conduct Surveillance assessments at MoD Abbey Wood and other UK sites, as determined, to confirm compliance with the requirements of ISO 9001 standard.

Please note this is the opportunity to submit your tender bid responses. Documentation available to submit to the Authority will be available to download and complete. Please ensure that the SAQ is complete failure to this will result in an automatic disqualification. Suppliers will be required to PASS the SAQ to compete.

Title: PXI System Configuration
Description: Durham University Department of Engineering require the configuration of its PCI eXtensions for Instrumentation.  (PXI) is a rugged PC-based platform that offers a high-performance, low-cost deployment solution for measurement and automation systems. PXI combines the Peripheral Component Interconnect (PCI) electrical bus with the rugged, modular Eurocard mechanical packaging of CompactPCI and adds specialized synchronization buses and key software features. PXI also adds mechanical, electrical, and software features that define complete systems for test and measurement, data acquisition, and manufacturing applications. These systems serve applications such as manufacturing test, military and aerospace, machine monitoring, automotive, and industrial test.

Title: Provision of Alcohol Health Promotion and Expert Support Service
Description:
The Authority is seeking 'Expressions of Interest' from suitable qualified and experienced organisations to provide a high-quality alcohol health promotion and an expert advice service. The organisation shall deliver a combination of quality assured alcohol health promotion and risk reduction materials (physical and digital content) to military staff. They will work with Defence Authorities to provide alcohol harm reduction expertise to advise on policy development and service delivery programmes.  

Two services are required: a range of alcohol health promotion, education, prevention, skills development and early intervention materials. These will be supplied as both physical and digital content, tailored to the needs of Defence both in terms of content and style (imagery and tone). Also, expertise, advice and guidance on clinical, research and general policy developments and may include an international element within the field of alcohol and alcohol related harm reduction.

Title: Dymchurch Martello Tower 24 Conservation Repair Work 2019
Description: The Project seeks to deliver a programme of essential conservation repair works to the tower which includes devegetation, dealing with defective pointing and deep tampering of open joints focusing on known areas of water ingress (i.e. the brick parapets and coping stones), removal of mould, stalactites, wood replacement and treatment, and lime washing to the interior which is currently in a poor condition, as well as repairs to the flagpole on the roof.  The proposed maintenance works are needed to understand the building's performance with an ultimate aim of reducing water ingress and creating a more sustainable condition for management and safe access by staff, volunteers and visitors.  There will also be some limited addition of defects remediation work such as repairs to the windows and sills, as well as a proposed works trial to remove a small section of coping stones to inform any future phases of the work.  The building is a Scheduled Ancient Monument and Grade II Listed and one of a chain of forts built along the South Coast between 1805 and 1812 to protect against the threat of an invasion by Napoleonic forces.  The building is the most accurate example remaining of an original Martello tower and closest to its original condition when occupied by the military in 1806.
Additional Text:
A contractors site visit will be organised on the morning of Monday 25th February 2019.  This will offer contractors an opportunity to view the site and ask any questions.  If you are interested in applying for the contract and wish to attend the site visit please email deborah.beeson@english-heritage.org.uk before 5pm on Thursday 21st February 2019. Title: Market Engagement Event for Counter Explosive Ordanance Defence Engagement (CEDE)
Description:
The MOD intends to increase support via an external supply chain to international partners facing the threat from explosive ordnance.  This includes improvised explosive devices (IEDs), mines, explosive remnants of war (ERW) and conventional munitions (CM).  The intent is to generate options for delivery (equipment, services and training) that combine military, police and external supply chain resources via a framework agreement.  This initiative aligns well to the National Security Strategy objectives; Protect our People, Project our Global Influence and Promote our Prosperity.

MOD would like to invite potential Suppliers (including SME's) who can provide Counter Explosive and Demolitions equipment, services and training to a market engagement event to discuss the opportunity. 
The event will be held at the FCO, King Charles Street, London, SW1A 2AH on the 22nd March 2019 at 12:30pm.

Should your organisation wish to attend the event please email:  tender.request@fco.gov.uk with the following details by COP 20th March 2019.

-	Organisation Name:
-	Names of Representative(s) attending (2 Max): 

The event will open with a presentation to outline the service provision and talk through the upcoming tender opportunity. This will last no more than one hour minutes. Following this presentation there will be an opportunity to ask questions regarding the opportunity only. 

The invitation to tender is expected to be issued by the 15th March 2019

Title: Counter-Explosive Ordanance, Defence - DPS
Description:
The Foreign Commonwealth Office Services (FCOS) is seeking to establish a Dynamic Purchasing System (DPS) Framework on behalf of the Ministry of Defence (MOD)

The MOD intends to increase support via an external supply chain to international partners facing the threat from explosive ordnance. This includes improvised explosive devices (IEDs), mines, explosive remnants of war (ERW) and conventional munitions (CM). The intent is to generate options for delivery (equipment, services and training) that combine military, police and external supply chain resources via a DPS framework. This initiative aligns well to the National Security Strategy objectives; Protect our People, Project our Global Influence and Promote our Prosperity.

It is the requirement that this DPS Framework opportunity is open to a wide variety of suppliers (SME's, VCSE's and larger organisations). Bidders who initially respond to this notice and successfully meet the Authority's criteria stipulated in the Selection Questionnaire (SQ), will be awarded a place on the DPS Framework.

Bidders who are successfully admitted to the DPS Framework will be eligible to participate in Mini-Competitions for the provision of Counter Explosive and Demolitions equipment, services and training.

The DPS Framework will be for a period of ten (10) years with a review within the first 12 months. A longer DPS Framework is required to ensure there are sufficient Mini-Competition opportunities to maximise market interest and sufficient opportunities for new entrants to join the DPS Framework.

For more information on this opportunity please go to www.fco.bravosolution.co.uk
Additional Text: Please submit your returned SQ and additional documents which can be uploaded in the general attachment area no later then 12:hrs Friday 10th May 2019

orgName: Police and Crime Commissioner for Dyfed Powys
Title: Provision of Catering Services
Description:
The catering service is to be provided at Police Headquarters, Llangunnor, Carmarthen which is the command and administrative centre of the Force. The Force has an establishment of 1,133 Police Officers and 868 Police staff. Approximately 700 staff work at Headquarters and some of these staff are part time and/or shift workers.

	The building is located approximately 1 mile from Carmarthen town and there are no alternative catering facilities in the immediate area.

Police Headquarters is a purpose built administrative building occupied in April 1987 which comprises offices and a residential unit for training and conferences.

The catering service will also be provided at the Strategic Co-ordination Centre (SCC) which is on the same site as Headquarters and is a purpose built Training/Conference facility occupied in September 2011. 

Training courses are held throughout the year.

The building is utilised for both emergency activation for major incidents and also exercises conducted on a multi-agency basis involving all emergency services, military and other public authorities. The SCC is also utilised on a daily basis for Training and Conferencing. 

The Powys Diner which is the main staff restaurant and the Pembrokeshire Café are both situated within the Headquarters building.
Additional Text:
This opportunity is being run through etenderwales

https://etenderwales.bravosolution.co.uk/

Title: Tempus Pro Specialist Support - Defence Medical Security Accreditor and Business Analyst
Description:
This is a direct award contract through G-Cloud 10 CCS Framework no RM1557.10.

Summary of Work - Defence Medical Security Accreditor/Capability Developer (SAC)
The SAC shall produce Technical development work to include security and JSP604 accreditation to enable Tempus Pro data transfer over MoD and Civilian bearers, and data connectivity for up to 100 Tempus Pro devices to Force Elements @ Readiness. To provide Technical support for the establishment of Response Centres.
Specific objectives are:
•	Continuation of SAC activity in FY19/20 including SAC support to JSP604 activity.
•	Develop Codes of Connection (CoCo) for connections for TP to military basebands.
•	Develop Target of Accreditation for RLI-based Corsium Suite using MedIS 1U Server.
•	Limited support to capability development events including TSI generation.
Essential Skills and experience:
•	Recent experience providing Security Accreditation Co-ordinator services to a Defence Communications project.
•	Be a ISO 27001 Lead Auditor
•	Be a member of CISSP
•	Experience as a SIRA

Summary of Work - Business Analyst
The medical device is fully accredited for standalone information storage. The Business Analyst will be required to develop this documentation, with the help of the project team, to achieve approval for network connectivity.
Specific objectives are:
•	Undertake JSP604 compliance activity on behalf of Authority, for Amazon Web Services-hosted Corsium.
•	Advise on ISS approvals and scrutiny process, including liaising between multiple ISS project teams.
•	Manage up to 6 capability events.
•	CONUSE, use case and User Requirements Document development, including two hosting solutions.
•	Future Med IS (CORTISONE) coherence activity.
Essential Skills and experience:
•	Recent experience producing a full requirements document set for a UK Defence communications project.
•	Experience of data flow analysis, IER production and architectural mapping to facilitate JSP 604 accreditation.
•	Experience of utilising Agile Business Analysis methodology.
•	Clear understanding of current UK tactical and strategic data basebands/bearers.

Contract Value Breakdown
Security Accreditor: £93,130 ex. VAT (134 days at £695.00 per day)
Business Analyst: £111,200 ex. VAT (160 days at £695.00 per day)
Optional Additional Technical and Specialist Support Call-Off Value: £100,080 ex. VAT (144 days at £695.00 per day)
Total Value: £304,410.00 ex. VAT

Title: UK SBS CR19003 Armed Forces Pay Review Body - Review of X-Factor Components
Description:
The final date and time for the submission of bids is Tuesday, 5th February 2019 at 11:00 Note: DO NOT apply directly to the buyer. Please disregard any content in this notice that requires your organisation 'to apply directly to the buyer' as this unfortunately is a system generated error that is outside of the contracting authorities control. All tender information MUST be submitted through the CCS eSourcing Portal. 
The aim of this project is to recommend a revised set of X-Factor components that will form the basis for future comparisons of key aspects of military and civilian employment. 
Please ensure you review all attached information to ensure a full understanding of this requirement. All attachments can be found with the RFx attachments tab within the Emptoris System. This contract will be awarded based on the evaluation criteria set out in the ITQ document. How to Apply As part of the strategic alliance between UK Shared Business Services Ltd (UK SBS) and Crown Commercial Service (CCS), UK SBS will be using the CCS eSourcing Suite for this procurement. To register on the CCS eSourcing portal please follow the details contained within the Additional Information section of this notice. If you are already registered on the CCS eSourcing portal and wish to register your interest in this opportunity please email; expressionofinterest@crowncommercial.gov.uk Your email must clearly state: • the name and reference for the procurement you wish to register for; • the name of the registered Bidder; • the name and contact details for the registered individual sending the email.

Title: Supply of Medical Devices Decontamination Capability - RFI
Description:
BACKGROUND
In April 15 the MOD signed a contract with Leidos Europe Ltd to provide the procurement and inventory management of commodity items (as well as the storage and distribution services) historically provided inhouse by the Logistic Commodities and Services Operating Centre. Leidos, working with the MOD, will transform the way these services are delivered to ensure requirements continue to be met whilst providing best value for money for the department. The organisation delivering these services is known as Team Leidos.

FUTURE ARRANGEMENTS
Team Leidos would like to make interested suppliers aware that it intends to invite tenders for the replacement of its current Medical Devices Decontamination Capability, with a view to awarding Contracts that will commence in 2020. 

The equipment is to be used in a variety of land and maritime environments Team Leidos require these to be shipped to Military Medical Facilities UK and Abroad. The main part of this requirement is to supply and support these products within normal industry lead times to these different sites. 

PROCESS
Team Leidos wishes to stimulate interest, information and views across the market for the supply of this requirement via this Request for Information (RFI) together with other companies whom Leidos believes may be able to provide useful intelligence on our requirement.

We do not require pricing at this stage, we are only interested to know which products, if any, you are able to supply.

If possible please provide a response to the attached questionaire within 5 working days.

Title: Provision of Emergency Airfield Cover for Boscombe Down Aerodrome
Description:
Emergency Medical provision required

Within 10 Minutes  of an emergency call the contractor will provide:

Airfield Incident

a.	Pre-Hospital emergency medical cover to preserve lives as safely as possible by providing triage, live-saving first aid, Basic Life Support and Advanced Life Support, until the casualties can receive the advanced trauma response and onward casualty transfer provided through the NHS ambulance service. In conjunction with the fire service and under the command of the Fire Master. 

Off-Site Incident

b.	Pre-Hospital emergency medical cover to preserve lives as safely as possible by providing triage, live-saving first aid, Basic Life Support and Advanced Life Support, until the casualties can receive the advanced trauma response and onward casualty transfer provided through the NHS ambulance service. In conjunction with the fire service and under the command of the Fire Master. 

Domestic Incident on Boscombe Down

c.	Pre-Hospital emergency medical cover to preserve lives as safely as possible by providing triage, live-saving first aid, Basic Life Support and Advanced Life Support, until the casualties can receive the advanced trauma response and onward casualty transfer provided through the NHS ambulance service. In conjunction with the fire service and under the command of the Fire Master. 

The Emergency Medical Airfield cover

This will consist of several elements including:

a.	Provision of Pre-Hospital Emergency Care and Treatment.
b.	Participation in all on and off (as determined by the exercise and training plans in conjunction with DPHC) site exercising and training events as directed by the Fire Master.
c.	Participation in the creation and generation of paramedic and technician response to major incident plans for the Airfield at MOD Boscombe Down as directed by the Fire Master.
d.	Regular review session with the Military Aviation Medical Examiner (MAME) Medical Officer responsible for MOD Boscombe Down based at the Bulford Medical Centre. 
e.	Support to the airfield in the management of aircraft and air personnel first aid kits destruction.

For a full description and how to apply for this opportunity please refer to the attachments to this Notice

Title: Board Management Software
Description:
The Defence Reform Act 2014 established the Single Source Regulations Office ("SSRO") as an independent regulator of the UK Government's procurement of single source military equipment and services. The SSRO is the custodian of the single source procurement framework and has several functions under the Act and the Single Source Contract Regulations 2014.
The SSRO is seeking to appoint a provider to deliver its Board Management System and associated software support services. The SSRO requires the service to ensure efficient and effective discharge of its functions.  
The scope of the procurement includes provision of a Board Management System package, the development and administration of the system and end user training and ongoing support. It also covers the management of the SSRO's data ensuring that it is kept safe, secure and available. 
The SSRO is seeking to appoint one supplier to the contract, which will run for a term of 37 months (including 1 month set up) plus an optional extension of 12 months.

Title: Mayflower Week Temporary Stage Structure
Description:
The provision of a temporary staging structure for the events held as part of the Mayflower Week. 

The Mayflower Week events will be developed and led by the Plymouth City Council Events Team.  The team are highly experienced and qualified, with vast amounts of experience in the delivery of major international events including MTV Crashes Plymouth, The British Firework Championships, The America's Cup and National Armed Forces Day.  

In support of delivering the Mayflower Week programme of events, the Council is seeking proposals for the provision of a temporary staging structure for the events held as part of the Mayflower Week.

The stage will be used for a number of major events on Plymouth Hoe between the 14th and 20th of September 2020.  

The stage will be the focal point for the week long commemorations; its design and functionality is key to making this a world class event on Plymouth Hoe.

During the course of the week of events the stage and associated structures will be used for live music performances ranging from live bands through to military bands and choirs as well as a number of prize giving and official ceremonies.

Title: Supply and Support of Diagnostic Ultrasound Devices - RFI
Description:
BACKGROUND

In April 15 the MOD signed a contract with Leidos Europe Ltd to provide the procurement and inventory management of commodity items (as well as the storage and distribution services) historically provided in-house by the Logistic Commodities and Services Operating Centre. Leidos, working with the MOD, will transform the way these services are delivered to ensure requirements continue to be met whilst providing best value for money for the department. The organisation delivering these services is known as Team Leidos.

FUTURE ARRANGEMENTS
 
Team Leidos would like to make interested suppliers aware that it intends to invite tenders for the Supply and Support of Diagnostic Ultrasound Devices for use in UK Medical Facilities, with a view to awarding Contracts that will commence in 2020. 

Team Leidos require these devices to be shipped to a central warehouse prior to installation in Military Medical Facilities within the UK.

Single Statement of Need 

A wheeled cart based system with a fixed screen suitable for Ultrasound of Musculoskeletal System (MSK), able to provide Diagnostic Ultrasound (DUS) capability to a range of body parts and with variable settings. It requires adjustable gain (overall and time gain compensation), depth, focus, power and colour Doppler, ability to flip images, provide extended field of view (panoramic), enhanced needle guidance and provide calliper measurement and split screen. Dynamic range, harmonics and compounding would also be beneficial.  A minimum of 3 transducers: 1 high frequency single crystal transducer linear probe, 1 low frequency linear probe and 1 hockey stick probe for smaller footprint imaging and guided injection to smaller parts. The system must be capable of saving/storing static images and short video clips in DICOM (Digital Imaging and Communication Standard in Medicine) format that enables transfer of images to external storage.

PROCESS

Team Leidos wishes to stimulate interest, information and views across the market for the supply of this requirement via this Request for Information (RFI) together with other companies whom Leidos believes may be able to provide useful intelligence on our requirement. 

We do not require pricing at this stage, we are only interested to know which products, if any, you are able to supply.  Please provide relevant Product Brochures and Specifications as appropriate. 

Summary

The results and analysis of this RFI shall not constitute any form of pre-qualification exercise and any formal procurement process will be undertaken in accordance with EU Procurement Law.
Nothing in this RFI, or any other engagements with Industry prior to a formal procurement process, shall be construed as a representation as to Leidos ultimate decision in relation to the future requirement. The publication of this RFI and associated documents in no way commits Leidos to pursue any tender process for the requirement.
Attachments: Supply and Support of Diagnostic Ultrasound Devices - RFI.docx

Title: Operational Ration Heater Systems (ORHS)
Description:
The requirement is for an Operational Ration Heater System (ORHS) which consists of portable metal stoveand solid fuel blocks to enable an individual to boil water and heat military field rations in a range of weatherconditions. The solid fuel must be Ethanol based (Bio-Fuel) any other fuels such as Hexamine will not beaccepted.
1: Heating Performance - The ORHS must be capable of boiling 500ml water to a temperature of 100C instandard issue MOD equipment (mess tins) within 11 minutes at an air temperature of -8C to +40C and sustainthe temperature for a period of 5 minutes.
2: Tactical Performance - The ORHS must function within 10 minutes of being immersed in water, this is to allowindividuals to prepare a meal after wading through water.
3: Tactical Performance - The ORHS must be as small and light as possible. The total weight (Stove & Fuel)must be max. 330g with sufficient fuel to heat a total of 6 meals or hot drinks.
4: Tactical Performance - The ORHS fuel must be tactically viable - smoke, noise, smell and light must be keptto a minimum.
5: Tactical Performance - The ORHS must be able to operate in poor climatic conditions and operate in wet andwindy weather.
6: Compatibility - The ORHS must be compatible with VIRTUS and OSPREY utility pouch and must be carriedin a utility pouch (16.5cm x 10cm x 7.5cm) and still b able to heat a minimum of 6 meals or hot drinks in a 24Hrperiod
7: Safety - The ORHS must be able to be safely transported in bulk by rail, air, road or sea.

orgName: Ministry of Defence, Ships, Salvage and Marine Operations (S&MO)
Title: Falkland Island Marine Services
Description: The Salvage & Marine Operations Team, within the MOD undertakes the through-life contract management of chartered specialist vessels which are essential for the operation of the Falkland Islands East Cove Military Port and outstations. The Team have a requirement to contract the provision of 2 harbour tugs and an additional vessel capable of undertaking specialist activities for up to 5 years. These activities will include but are not limited to: harbour tug duties, coastal re-supply, re-fuelling, fire-fighting, oil spill response and the maintenance of moorings, fenders and fuel hoses. The vessels will be required to support Single Point Mooring maintenance and provide a platform for Commercial Diving. This Falkland Island Marine Services project is currently an unfunded initiative. In issuing this PIN, the MOD is not committing to carry out any procurement in relation to the strategy stated in this PIN. Any related future procurement activity will be subject to the PCR 2015.

Title: Digital solutions and technologies: procurement options for Canterbury City Council covering Waste, Recycling and Street Cleansing Services Market Research Day
Description:
The Council is in the process of setting up a Local Authority Trading Company, and is looking to procure a software package and information systems, either in the name of the Local Authority Trading Company or in the Council's name, to support the provision of refuse, recycling and street cleansing services. It is envisaged the new digital solution be available from 21st January 2021 onwards. 
The Council is undergoing a significant transformation programme to put our customers at the heart of everything we do. As a part of our early engagement with the market, we will share our insight into the needs, journeys and scenarios that our customers face when accessing waste and street cleansing services.  We will also be explicit about the way we want the new contract to be digitally-led and technology-driven to ensure staff can work efficiently and effectively in delivering one of our most valued and universal services.
Interested parties are invited to attend a Market Research Day on Tuesday 26 November 2019. A maximum of three (3) representatives per economic operator will be permitted to attend. It is planned the Market Research Day will be held at Canterbury City Council offices, Military Road, Canterbury, CT1 1YW
Interview  sessions will be exclusive to your company and last for up to 90 minutes maximum. This will be issued on a first served basis.
Please register your interest in attending this day by responding directly on the Kent Business portal. Please confirm your attendance along with the representatives by 15 November  2019.

Title: Security and information Risk Advisor (SIRA) services
Description:
The Defence Reform Act 2014 established the Single Source Regulations Office ("SSRO") as an independent regulator of the UK Government's procurement of single source military equipment and services. The SSRO is the custodian of the single source procurement framework and has several functions under the Act and the Single Source Contract Regulations 2014.
The SSRO is seeking to appoint a provider of Security and information Risk Advisor (SIRA) services to deliver advice on the management of security and information risk consistent with the UK Government's information assurance policy and other sector specific guidance, with particular emphasis on the specific requirements of the Single Source Regulations Office as an independent executive body of the Ministry of Defence
The SSRO is seeking to appoint one supplier to the contract, which will run for a term of 24 months, with the option of up to two extensions of 12 months each at the SSRO's sole discretion.

Title: Supply of Portable Lightweight Forward Operating Platforms (Surgical Tables), Including Additional Aids
Description: Team Leidos would like to make interested suppliers aware that it intends to tender for the supply of portable,lightweight, readily deployable operating platforms (Surgical Tables). The solution should enable surgical teams to deliver Damage Control Surgery (DCS) procedures (operative procedures to the head, thorax,abdomen, pelvis and limbs). The solution should be usable within theatre entry standard Deployed Hospital Care (DHC) and Forward Military Treatment Facilities, by Land, Littoral and Specialist Surgical Teams which support UK formations. The solution should be usable within all environmental conditions and operational areas.Contracts would commence during 2020 for a period of up to 4 years. The Framework may include annual servicing, repair, spare parts and consumables. For more information on the device please contact us on the abovementioned details.
Additional Text:
Team Leidos are proud to be delivering the logistics commodities and services transformation (LCS(T))Delivery partner Contracts (LCS (T)/0001 dated 16.4.2015) on behalf of the UK Ministry of Defence (the 'Prime Contract'). Delivery of other parts of the LCS(T) contract are delivered by Leidos Europe Ltd (LEL) and other partners (together 'Team Leidos').
Team Leidos wishes to stimulate interest, information and views across the market for the fulfilment of this requirement via this PIN.
This prior information notice is not a means to submit a formal expression of interest in respect of any potential tender. Any resultant requirement will be subject to the EU Public Procurement Regulations and respective advertising action.
For further information, please contact Crysta Burridge via email (Crysta.Burridge103@teamleidos.mod.uk ) or Telephone +44 117 3323088.

orgName: Ministry of Defence, Helicopters, Apache Project Team
Title: Procurement of One (1) PFMTF (Pre Flight Message Test Facility) Rig and Two (2) STF (System Test Facility) Rig
Description: The Apache PT, part of UK Ministry of Defence ("MoD"), intends to place a single source, Qualifying Defence Contract (QDC) with Leonardo MW Ltd by May 2020 to manufacture a UK Apache AH 64E Pre-Flight Message Test Facility (PFMTF) rig. This Contract will be placed using the Negotiated Procedure Without Prior Publication of a Contract Notice pursuant to Article 28(1)(e) of Directive 2009/81/EC (Regulation 16(1) (a) (ii) of the Defence and Security Public Contracts Regulations (2011) for technical reasons. The Authority has a requirement for one (1) x PFMTF rig to allow a fully worldwide operational DAS (Defensive Aids System). Alongside this a need to test repairs and conduct function/fault analysis whilst in-service through a STF (System Test Facility). The DAS is a Military Commercial off the Shelf item that feeds into the flight management system. The Contract award will be based on a 54-month contracting period (18-month manufacturing including a 36-month telephone support package).

orgName: Ministry of Defence, DE&S ISTAR Windfarm Team
Title: Paper-based Feasibility study and possible future Demonstration of Mature Solutions for Improving Air Surveillance for the Purposes of Air Defence in Airspace affected by Wind Farms
Description: Wind turbines can adversely affect a number of MOD operations including radars, seismological recording equipment, communications facilities, naval operations and low flying. These effects are not limited to specific geographical areas. The size of wind turbines as well as the geographical footprint of the next generation of wind farm developments are expected to grow significantly and exacerbate the challenges posed to the UK's AD infrastructure.  A solution is required to enable the continued operation of military AD surveillance capability in the presence of current and future wind turbine developments.

Title: Outsourced Finance Support Service
Description:
Detailed description of the notice you are adding:

The Defence Reform Act 2014 established the Single Source Regulations Office ("SSRO") as an independent regulator of the UK Government's procurement of single source military equipment and services.  The SSRO is the custodian of the single source procurement framework and has a number of functions under the Act and the Single Source Contract Regulations 2014.
The SSRO is seeking to award a 36-month contract (plus an initial 3months for Implementation) for the provision of Outsourced Finance Support Services. The SSRO requires these services to ensure the efficient and effective discharge of its functions. 

The Outsourced Finance Support services which the SSRO requirements are summarised in the below:

Finance service 	Financial Accounting Services: maintain the integrity of the financial database and chart of accounts by undertaking periodic housekeeping and reconciliation routines on the General Ledger.

Management Accounting Service: maintain the integrity of the structures (e.g. chart of accounts, activity centre structure, journal definitions) within the financial database.

Resource accounts: ensure this element of the Annual Report and Accounts provides a true and fair view of the SSRO's financial position at the time of the preparation of the accounts.

Payments to suppliers and employees: provision of a payments service via a secure environment within the parameters of available systems controls, for the upload of purchase ledger transactions, through to the production and dispatch of the required payment instrument, (including BACS and CHAPS).

orgName: Ministry of Defence, Air Support, Other
Title: Electro-Mechanical Training Contract 2
Description:
The Defence College of Technical Training (DCTT) delivers technical training to military personnel from across Defence.  The College currently comprises of 4 Schools across a number of sites, including MOD Lyneham in Wiltshire and HMS SULTAN in Gosport.  MOD Lyneham is home to the Defence School of Electronic and Mechanical Engineering (DSEME) and the School of Army Aeronautical Engineering (SAAE), and HMS SULTAN is home to the Defence School of Marine Engineering (DSMarE) and the Royal Naval Air Engineering and Survival Equipment School (RNAESS).
      
      The Electro-Mechanical Training Contract (EMTC) will deliver initial and subsequent electro-mechanical and marine engineering trade training and support services at both of the HMS SULTAN and MOD Lyneham sites under a single contract; which will equate to circa 900,000 individual training days a year. The requirement is for a period of 5 years, subject to options for the Authority to extend for up to 2 years, as set out below. The anticipated contract start date is 1 May 21 to allow for a 6 month transition period before full service commencement from 1 November 2021.
Additional Text:

        http://www.contracts.mod.uk/delta/signup.html?userType=supplier
        
        and search for the notice with reference 'UK-Walter's Ash: Education and training services.'.

Title: DInfoCom/0096 - PROVISION OF INNOVATION ARCHITECT
Description: The Defence and Army is embracing a culture of innovation to realise efficiencies, but more importantly force optimisation. The Defence and Security Accelerator, JFC led jHUB and Army Research, Innovation and Experimentation Laboratory provide a rich landscape to exploit innovation. Additionally, issues raised by the Service Enquiry into the deaths of Reserve Special Forces selection and strategic views of how Army conducts software licensing all require support to innovation activities. IM innovation requires an expedient delivery of capability into service with adoption of a learn fast approach to concepts. To ensure we continue to leverage business benefits from our innovation activities requires a broadening of the SQEP and KSE within the Directorate; the ability to better bridge the industry and military use of technologies, solutions and services. To resource the direction on innovation and experimentation requires additional service support.

Title: DInfoCom/0109 - PROVISION OF HARDWARE, SOFTWARE & SUPPORT FOR SPCB
Description:
The Service Police Crime Bureau (SPCB) on behalf of the Service Police has a legal requirement to the service Justice System under the Armed Forces Act 2006 to investigate criminal and non-criminal conduct offences, seize and recover evidential material and conduct timely analysis for its use in Court Martials and civilian proceedings, as well as manage all policing information in accordance with Management of Police Information (MOPI)/Military Police Investigative Doctrine (MPID). 

The SPCB Application Support Team (AST) is responsible for managing and maintaining all Service Police Information Systems namely the CRIMES network architecture at Southwick Park and RAF St Mawgan.  The CRIMES datacentre houses the Service Police's most critical IT systems and services that are vital to the continuity of Service Police capabilities and operational effectiveness worldwide.

If any contract documents are accompanied by instructions on safeguarding classified information (e.g. a Security Aspects Letter), the Authority reserves the right to amend the terms of these instructions to reflect any changes in national law or government policy, whether in respect of the applicable protective marking scheme, specific protective markings given, the aspects to which any protective marking applies, or otherwise.         Residential property renting or leasing services. To provide military Service Personnel in the United Kingdom (UK) of Great Britain and Northern Ireland including the Isle of Man and the Channel Islands, with Substitute Accommodation.  This comprises of shared multi-occupancy Substitute Service Single Accommodation (SSSA) and Substitute Service Family Accommodation (SSFA) for couples and families.

Title: Provision of Environmental Health Training
Description:
Defence Environmental and Occupational Health based at Defence Medical Services Whittington, Lichfield. The Authority is seeking 'Expressions of Interest' from an academic Contractor. The Contractor must already be a provider of an existing Chartered Institute of Environmental Health (CIEH) accredited BSc/MSc programme to provide a comprehensive service to co-deliver and validate a CIEH accredited BSc (Hons) Degree in Environmental Health Studies. 
      
      Military students accepted for the programme shall be registered as candidates for a qualification with the Contractor and shall enrol with the Authority.
      
      Delivery of the educational elements of the BSc award is to be split into 5 Blocks, which have been mapped over to the CIEH Curriculum.  There is potential for flexibility in the timing of the Contractor's delivered modules.
Additional Text:
To view this notice, register as a supplier here:
        
        http://www.contracts.mod.uk/delta/signup.html?userType=supplier
        
        and search for the notice with reference 'UK-Lichfield: Education and training services.'.

orgName: Ministry of Defence, IMOC, Defence Fuels Group
Title: DFAP/0028 - Singapore Fuels Project
Description: Supply of Bulk Marine & Marine Aviation Fuels, for the UK Ministry of Defence (MoD), to be Delivered Duty Paid (DDP) to the British Defence Singapore Support Unit (BDSSU), at Sembawang Naval Wharf (SNW), Singapore. The Fuel Types delivered under the Singapore Fuels Project include F-76 (Marine) to Def Stan 91-4 (latest issue) & F-44 to Def Stan 91-86 (latest issue) / JP-5 (Marine Aviation) to Military Spec MIL-DTL-5624 (latest issue).
Additional Text:
To view this notice, register as a supplier here:
        
        http://www.contracts.mod.uk/delta/signup.html?userType=supplier
        
        and search for the notice with reference 'UK-Bristol: Fuels.'.
